page.title: 01SHILLINGSTONE AREA
page.content: Our area is in the Blackmore Vale.The river Stour traverses it from North West to South East, and the valley is bounded on South West by Shillingstone and Okeford hills,and on the East by Hambledon Hill. The hills are formed of Middle Chalk,and the valley from Greensand and alluvial deposits. There are three small vllages,known locally as the Three Okefords:Childe Okeford,Okeford Fitzpaine and Shillingstone(once called Shilling Okeford).All three have been inhabited since at least Saxon times.There is a small hamlet in the North West called Fiddleford,where there is an old mill on the river.The area is mainly farmland(,mostly dairy with some arable,) and woodland,with some light industry.Population includes commuters,the retired and farmworkers.
